department.ch: 水文與海洋科學研究所碩士班
department.en: MSc in Hydrologocal and  Oceanic Sciences

goal.ch: 著重探討陸地水文循環之地表水與地下水之水文循環物理機制。地表水部分包含流域面積降水估計、蒸發散物理機制、河川洪水演算；地下水部分涵蓋土壤水分與地下水流計算。工程水文與分析將結合理論介紹與實務應用。
goal.en: “The land phase of the earth hydrological cycle contains two major components: surface and subsurface hydrology. It involves the movement and distribution of water on the earth surface and groundwater in subsurface. This course is designed to provide students with fundamental knowledge of physical aspects describing the land hydrological cycles. The part of surface hydrology focuses on the estimation of areal precipitation, evapotranspiration physics, stream flow routing, and basin runoff modeling. The part of subsurface hydrology will emphasize on the physics of soil water storage and flow and basic principles of groundwater flow. Engineering hydrological analysis is arranged at the last two lectures.“

outline.ch:
1. 簡介水文循環概念
2. 降水觀測與面積降水估計
3. 蒸發散與截留過程
4. 土壤水分與入滲
5. 地下水與地表水交互關聯
6. 河川演算與降雨逕流模擬
7. 水文歷線分析
8. 水文頻率分析
outline.en:
“1. Introduction and basic hydrologic concepts: definition and scope of hydrology; overview of hydrological cycle and basin characteristics
2. Precipitation: meteorology of precipitation, point measurement and areal estimation
3. Evaportranspiration and interception: physics of evaporation, transpiration; potential evapotranspiration; interception loss
4. Soil water: material properties of soil; soil-water storage and flow; infiltration
5. Groundwater: basic principles of groundwater flow; groundwater-surface water relations
6. Stream response to water-input events: basic aspects of stream response; streamflow routing; rainfall-runoff modeling
7. Hydrograph analysis: unit hydrograph, S-hydrograph, instantaneous unit hydrograph
8. Hydrological frequency analysis: return period, extreme value distribution, reliability and risk“

textbook.ch:
“1. Dingman, S. L., 2002, Physical Hydrology, 2nd ed., Prentice Hall.
2. Viessman, W. Jr. and G. L. Lewis, 2003, Introduction to Hydrology, 5th ed., Harper Collins.
3. Brutsaert, W., 2005, Hydrology: An Introduction, Cambridge University Press.
4. Bras, R. L., 1990, Hydrology: An Introduction to Hydrologic Science, Addision-Wesley.
5. Chow, V. T., D. R. Maidment, and L. W. Mays, 1998, Applied Hydrology, McGraw-Hill.
6. McCuen, R. H., 1998, Hydrologic Analysis and Design, Prentice Hall.“
textbook.en:
“1. Dingman, S. L., 2002, Physical Hydrology, 2nd ed., Prentice Hall.
2. Viessman, W. Jr. and G. L. Lewis, 2003, Introduction to Hydrology, 5th ed., Harper Collins.
3. Brutsaert, W., 2005, Hydrology: An Introduction, Cambridge University Press.
4. Bras, R. L., 1990, Hydrology: An Introduction to Hydrologic Science, Addision-Wesley.
5. Chow, V. T., D. R. Maidment, and L. W. Mays, 1998, Applied Hydrology, McGraw-Hill.
6. McCuen, R. H., 1998, Hydrologic Analysis and Design, Prentice Hall.“

gradMethod.ch: 小考與作業 (40％)、第一次考試 (30％)、第二次考試 (30％)
gradMethod.en: Quiz ＆ Homework (40％); Exam I (30％); Exam II (30％)
